snippet: Reporting and policing can be a high adrenaline business. But the decade-long trajectory in New York is toward expanded police power.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column says decade-long trajectory in New York City toward expanded police power has allowed officers to suppress journalistic coverage of the Occupy Wall Street protests, despite police assurances and regulations to the contrary.
lead_paragraph: Reporting and policing can be a high adrenaline business. But the decade-long trajectory in New York is toward expanded police power.

headline.seo: At Wall Street Protests, Clash of Reporting and Policing
headline.main: The Rules on News Coverage Are Clear, but the Police Keep Pushing
headline.print_headline: The Rules on News Coverage Are Clear, but the Police Keep Pushing
